title: Man claims £150,000 in benefits while claiming the only job he could do is being a celebrity
text:
'BORN TO ENTERTAIN' Man claims £150,000 in benefits while claiming the only job he could do is being a celebrity 
James Alton, 30, has spent thousands pursuing his dream of being a star By Sara Kamouni Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A WANNABE celeb has claimed £150,000 in benefits – and insists being a star is the only job that would suit him. 
James Alton, 30, says his bipolar disorder prevents him from holding down a job. E4 5 James Alton, from Derby, believes he is destined for stardom 
But the Sunday People reports in the last year, he has spent £7,650 of his £10,402 of benefits on trying to become famous. 
This reportedly covered the costs of a manager, casting website adverts, clothes and shoes and travel to auditions. 
James, whose stage name is Jamesy, told the Sunday People: “I don’t care what people say, entertaining is what I was born to do. E4 James Alton appearing in Stage School, shown on E4 Facebook/ James Alton 5 James splashes out thousands on new clothes and shoes for auditions 
“It makes me happy so why should I do a job that makes me depressed when I can do this instead? 
“I’d love to keep a full time job but I am bipolar, you can’t take that away from me. I get a lot of stick about it, people think being bipolar isn’t a real diagnosis.” Read More 'THE FROG HAS BOILED' Top general warns of gaping holes' left in UK's defences by shoddy kit after years of 'hollowing out' SNACK SIZE Chocolate manfacturers announce bars are set to shrink by 20 per cent as government wages war on sugar MARKET PERV NABBED Paedo banned from having contact with kids for downloading thousands of sick abuse pics found running city-centre TOY SHOP GEORGE DEATH PROBE Police investigating George Michael's death officially rule out foul play - but cause remains a mystery 'MUSLIM BAN' HITS HERO British soldier awarded Victoria Cross for action in Iraq 'humiliated' in US by THREE-HOUR airport quiz over passport stamp SERVICES SUICIDES Shocking figures reveal war zone veterans make up 70 per cent of Armed Forces suicides activist's vile commons rant Winston Churchill's mum was bondage hooker, claims activist Omowale Rupert in bizarre House of Commons rant jailhouse dock Max Clifford to appeal sex assault convictions with 'significant' new evidence linked to Elvis' death seven of the best Wounded war heroes show off medal haul after running marathon on every continent to raise money for soldiers' rehab centre 'HE DIED TOO YOUNG' Queen embarks on personal day of reflection on the 65th anniversary of death of dad King George IV and her sudden rise to the throne Opera con Fraudsters cash in buying expensive opera tickets with stolen credit cards & flogging them on open market TRIAL EARNER Inside the posh yacht rotters behind £1bn HBOS asset-stripping scam used to make nearly £1m during trial... despite having their assets frozen 
In the past year, James, who lives alone in a Derby housing association flat, claims he has appeared as an extra or audience member on the likes of Towie, Britain’s Got Talent and Big Brother’s Bit On The Side. 
He has also auditioned for Big Brother six times – but reckons his alter-ego ‘Mrs Plonka’ could be his key to stardom. ITV James Alton on reality show Britain’s Got Talent E4 5 James also has an alter-ego, Mrs Plonka 
But in a letter to James’ benefits office, his doctor said: “Mr Alton’s presentation does not fit the criteria for a classic bipolar illness and at most, it is bipolar type 3 which is just a spectrum disorder rather than an illness.” 
A DWP spokesman said: “Claimants are expected to do everything they can to find work if they are able to, in return for their benefits.” We pay for your stories ! Do you have a story for The Sun Online news team? Email us at or call 0207 782 4368
